lg.l: well these love to gibe,
And throw their Jests on Tribe!
Must be toil'd to Death, they cry,
Whilst other Priests are yawning by?
Forgetful that reaps the Gain,
Why should waste their Lungs in vain?
Men were weak enough to prize
The Scheme, as good and wise,
To think there was an Heav'n and Hell;
To and did very well:
When Mortals look'd beyond the Grave,
A Priest, for sake, might slave:
But in this learned Realm and Age,
Where is beaten off the Stage;
This happy Realm, where reigns,
And scorns to drag Chains;
Where free-born , ev'ry Day,
And, since their buys their Meat,
Won't thank their God for what they eat;
Where e'vn some Chaplains fill their Place
Politely, without saying Grace:
here, (where swells so high,
It dares all other Pow'rs defy)
The Priests are, like the Laymen, wise,
Nor hope in the Skies;
